title: ‘I’m for America’: NYC Mayor Eric Adams leaves door open to potential GOP switch
content: NYC Mayor Eric Adams, a Democrat, hinted at a possible return to the Republican Party, emphasizing national unity over party lines. He praised bipartisanship and avoided criticizing Trump, sparking controversy among fellow Democrats. Adams faces federal charges, and Trump's potential influence on the case adds complexity. He plans to seek re-election as a Democrat.
summary: NYC Mayor Eric Adams, a Democrat, hinted at a possible return to the Republican Party, emphasizing national unity over party lines.  He praised bipartisanship and avoided criticizing Trump, sparking controversy among fellow Democrats.  Adams faces federal charges, and Trump's potential influence on the case adds complexity.  He plans to seek re-election as a Democrat.

title: Will Melania Trump never appear on the cover of any magazine as First Lady? Is it a dig at Jill Biden?
content: Melania Trump dismissed the snub by the magazines that she was not featured on the cover of any during her first stint as the first lady as she said she has many important things to do other than appearing on the cover of any magazine. "I think the life would not change for anybody if I am on the cover of any magazine," Melania said in a Fox interview in a veiled dig at Jill Biden who was the Vogue cover for August.
summary: Melania Trump dismissed the snub by the magazines that she was not featured on the cover of any during her first stint as the first lady as she said she has many important things to do other than appearing on the cover of any magazine. "I think the life would not change for anybody if I am on the cover of any magazine," Melania said in a Fox interview in a veiled dig at Jill Biden who was the Vogue cover for August.

title: Brian Thompson killing: UnitedHealthcare removes executive info from website after CEO's death
content: Days after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was killed in a targeted shooting, the company removed its executive list from its website. Thompson, 50, was fatally shot while walking to a conference in Midtown Manhattan. Investigators are probing links between the attack and Thompson’s role in the insurance industry, with evidence including engraved shell casings and a suspect using fake IDs.
summary: Days after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was killed in a targeted shooting, the company removed its executive list from its website. Thompson, 50, was fatally shot while walking to a conference in Midtown Manhattan. Investigators are probing links between the attack and Thompson’s role in the insurance industry, with evidence including engraved shell casings and a suspect using fake IDs.

title: 'Ashamed to be an American': Teacher claims she was fired for posting anti-Trump content on social media
content: A Beverly Hills teacher, Joanie Garratt, alleges she was fired for criticizing pro-Trump student behavior and the former president on her private Facebook account. The school district denies firing her, claiming she was a substitute teacher whose assignment ended. The incident followed a pro-Trump rally where students allegedly harassed classmates, sparking debate about free speech and educator rights.
summary: A Beverly Hills teacher, Joanie Garratt, alleges she was fired for criticizing pro-Trump student behavior and the former president on her private Facebook account. The school district denies firing her, claiming she was a substitute teacher whose assignment ended. The incident followed a pro-Trump rally where students allegedly harassed classmates, sparking debate about free speech and educator rights.

title: JD Vance explains how he and his 'closest friends in tech world' David Sacks became pro-Trump
content: JD Vance lauded David Sacks, a close friend and tech entrepreneur, for his transition to a staunch Trump supporter. Both initially critical of Trump in 2016, they united by 2020, viewing Trump as crucial against political and cultural 'insanity.
summary: JD Vance lauded David Sacks, a close friend and tech entrepreneur, for his transition to a staunch Trump supporter. Both initially critical of Trump in 2016, they united by 2020, viewing Trump as crucial against political and cultural 'insanity.

title: Merciful President? After Hunter, Biden is considering pre-emptive pardons for these individuals
content: Among those reportedly being considered for pardons are Anthony S. Fauci, known for leading the US covid-19 response; retired General Mark A. Milley, former chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, who called Trump a "fascist"; Senator-elect Adam Schiff (D-California), who led Trump’s first impeachment; and ex-Congresswoman Liz Cheney (R-Wyoming), a prominent Republican critic of Trump.
summary: Among those reportedly being considered for pardons are Anthony S. Fauci, known for leading the US covid-19 response; retired General Mark A. Milley, former chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, who called Trump a "fascist"; Senator-elect Adam Schiff (D-California), who led Trump’s first impeachment; and ex-Congresswoman Liz Cheney (R-Wyoming), a prominent Republican critic of Trump.

title: Why is JetBlue announcing major route cuts to these US cities?
content: JetBlue Airways is restructuring its flight network in 2025, cutting routes from major hubs like JFK, Miami, and Austin to boost profitability. The airline will eliminate flights to destinations such as Houston, Paris, and London Gatwick, while also discontinuing Mint service on Seattle routes. This decision follows challenges in Florida's competitive market and anticipated aircraft groundings due to engine issues.
summary: JetBlue Airways is restructuring its flight network in 2025, cutting routes from major hubs like JFK, Miami, and Austin to boost profitability.  The airline will eliminate flights to destinations such as Houston, Paris, and London Gatwick, while also discontinuing Mint service on Seattle routes.  This decision follows challenges in Florida's competitive market and anticipated aircraft groundings due to engine issues.

title: How 'AI Czar' David Sacks and tech bros helped Trump red-pill America
content: Silicon Valley’s conservative-libertarian contingent has long criticised Washington’s bureaucracy as a brake on innovation. Now, with Sacks at the helm, that contingent stands to reshape America’s AI, cryptocurrency, and digital policy landscape, with promises of deregulation and market-driven leadership.
summary: Silicon Valley’s conservative-libertarian contingent has long criticised Washington’s bureaucracy as a brake on innovation. Now, with Sacks at the helm, that contingent stands to reshape America’s AI, cryptocurrency, and digital policy landscape, with promises of deregulation and market-driven leadership.

title: Melania Trump says it's not possible for Barron to be a 'normal student' because...
content: In her first Fox interview since Donald Trump's re-election, Melania Trump discussed Barron's crucial role in Donald Trump's campaigning. ​He brought in so many young people of his generation... because nowadays the young generation doesn't sit in front of the TV anymore; they are all on the tablets, on their phones. It's incredible how Barron brought in success as he knew exactly who his father needed to contact and to talk to," Melania said.
summary: In her first Fox interview since Donald Trump's re-election, Melania Trump discussed Barron's crucial role in Donald Trump's campaigning. ​He brought in so many young people of his generation... because nowadays the young generation doesn't sit in front of the TV anymore; they are all on the tablets, on their phones. It's incredible how Barron brought in success as he knew exactly who his father needed to contact and to talk to," Melania said.

title: Trump confirms Pete Hegseth will not be replaced: 'Nothing can be done...'
content: ​"Pete Hegseth is doing very well. His support is strong and deep, much more so than the Fake News would have you believe. He was a great student - Princeton/Harvard educated - with a Military state of mind. He will be a fantastic, high energy, Secretary of Defense Defense, one who leads with charisma and skill. Pete is a WINNER, and there is nothing that can be done to change that!!!" Donald Trump posted on Truth Social.
summary: ​"Pete Hegseth is doing very well. His support is strong and deep, much more so than the Fake News would have you believe. He was a great student - Princeton/Harvard educated - with a Military state of mind. He will be a fantastic, high energy, Secretary of Defense Defense, one who leads with charisma and skill. Pete is a WINNER, and there is nothing that can be done to change that!!!" Donald Trump posted on Truth Social.

title: Does Pete Hegseth have a drinking problem? What we know so far
content: Pete Hegseth, an Army veteran, has acknowledged using alcohol as a coping mechanism after his 2006 Iraq deployment, describing it as “self-medication” during a challenging reintegration into civilian life. In his 2016 book In the Arena and a 2021 podcast, he admitted to drinking heavily during that time. However, Hegseth credits his faith and wife Jennifer for helping him overcome these habits, stating, “Only by the grace of God was I able to undo that cycle.” Despite these admissions, he denies having a drinking problem, asserting he has never required or been advised to seek professional help.
summary: Pete Hegseth, an Army veteran, has acknowledged using alcohol as a coping mechanism after his 2006 Iraq deployment, describing it as “self-medication” during a challenging reintegration into civilian life. In his 2016 book In the Arena and a 2021 podcast, he admitted to drinking heavily during that time. However, Hegseth credits his faith and wife Jennifer for helping him overcome these habits, stating, “Only by the grace of God was I able to undo that cycle.” Despite these admissions, he denies having a drinking problem, asserting he has never required or been advised to seek professional help.

title: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy making 'naughty' and 'nice' lists. This is for...
content: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy, leading Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), met with House Republicans to discuss budget cuts. They proposed "nice" and "naughty" lists for Congress members based on how they support DOGE's budget-slashing proposals. DOGE aims to cut the US federal budget by at least $2 trillion.
summary: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy, leading Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), met with House Republicans to discuss budget cuts. They proposed "nice" and "naughty" lists for Congress members based on how they support DOGE's budget-slashing proposals. DOGE aims to cut the US federal budget by at least $2 trillion.

title: Why Republicans are confident Kash Patel will be confirmed as FBI chief
content: Republican Senator John Cornyn and other influential figures within the GOP have publicly declared that Patel has the necessary votes for confirmation. This assertion reflects careful planning and strategic coordination among Senate Republicans, aimed at securing support for Trump’s nominee. Prominent senators, including Ted Cruz and Lindsey Graham, have also voiced their backing, bolstering the party’s confidence in the outcome.
summary: Republican Senator John Cornyn and other influential figures within the GOP have publicly declared that Patel has the necessary votes for confirmation. This assertion reflects careful planning and strategic coordination among Senate Republicans, aimed at securing support for Trump’s nominee. Prominent senators, including Ted Cruz and Lindsey Graham, have also voiced their backing, bolstering the party’s confidence in the outcome.

title: Reddit thread on UnitedHealthcare CEO shot dead deleted as doctors celebrate murder
content: ​The moderators of the deleted Reddit post said that the post was removed as it was unproductive, "a time suck for the mods, without a good source, being brigade, arguably against Reddit's terms of service and featured too many inappropriate comments. It wasn't because of criticism of business practices. We criticize insurance business practices frequently here."
summary: ​The moderators of the deleted Reddit post said that the post was removed as it was unproductive, "a time suck for the mods, without a good source, being brigade, arguably against Reddit's terms of service and featured too many inappropriate comments. It wasn't because of criticism of business practices. We criticize insurance business practices frequently here."

title: Who is David Sacks? Elon Musk’s former PayPal ally turned AI & Crypto Czar in Trump’s administration
content: Donald Trump appointed David Sacks, former PayPal executive and venture capitalist, as the White House AI and Crypto Czar. Sacks, a member of the "PayPal Mafia," will guide policy on artificial intelligence and cryptocurrency. He's a prominent tech figure and co-host of the All-In Podcast. A vocal proponent of cryptocurrency, Sacks has described the rise of Bitcoin as a revolutionary moment for the internet. Interestingly, Sacks was involved in ousting Elon Musk, now also appointed by Trump, from PayPal over two decades ago.
summary: Donald Trump appointed David Sacks, former PayPal executive and venture capitalist, as the White House AI and Crypto Czar.  Sacks, a member of the "PayPal Mafia," will guide policy on artificial intelligence and cryptocurrency.  He's a prominent tech figure and co-host of the All-In Podcast.  A vocal proponent of cryptocurrency, Sacks has described the rise of Bitcoin as a revolutionary moment for the internet. Interestingly, Sacks was involved in ousting Elon Musk, now also appointed by Trump, from PayPal over two decades ago.

title: Former Chilean president Michelle Bachelet to receive 2024 Indira Gandhi Peace Prize
content: Former Chilean president Michelle Bachelet has been awarded the 2024 Indira Gandhi Prize for Peace, Disarmament and Development. The award recognizes her global advocacy for human rights, gender equality, and the rights of vulnerable populations. Bachelet's career includes leading UN Women, serving as UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, and implementing significant reforms during her two presidential terms.
summary: Former Chilean president Michelle Bachelet has been awarded the 2024 Indira Gandhi Prize for Peace, Disarmament and Development. The award recognizes her global advocacy for human rights, gender equality, and the rights of vulnerable populations. Bachelet's career includes leading UN Women, serving as UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, and implementing significant reforms during her two presidential terms.

title: 'Kinda hot': How UnitedHealthcare CEO's assassin became America's new 'thirst trap'
content: Amid the serious discussions, a surprising and surreal narrative emerged: the alleged killer’s unexpected rise as a “thirst trap.” Surveillance images released by law enforcement showed a suspect with striking features, sparking comparisons to actors like Timothée Chalamet and Josh O’Connor—icons of the so-called “Rodent Man” aesthetic. Social media users began commenting on the suspect’s angular jawline, prominent cheekbones, and brooding demeanour, turning him into an unlikely object of online fascination.
summary: Amid the serious discussions, a surprising and surreal narrative emerged: the alleged killer’s unexpected rise as a “thirst trap.” Surveillance images released by law enforcement showed a suspect with striking features, sparking comparisons to actors like Timothée Chalamet and Josh O’Connor—icons of the so-called “Rodent Man” aesthetic. Social media users began commenting on the suspect’s angular jawline, prominent cheekbones, and brooding demeanour, turning him into an unlikely object of online fascination.

title: What will happen next in South Korea if President Yoon is removed?
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces mounting calls for impeachment after declaring martial law and accusing the opposition of supporting North Korea. His own party leader backs impeachment, and the military refuses to enforce further martial law orders. The opposition needs a few more votes to suspend Yoon, with the prime minister set to take over if successful.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces mounting calls for impeachment after declaring martial law and accusing the opposition of supporting North Korea.  His own party leader backs impeachment, and the military refuses to enforce further martial law orders.  The opposition needs a few more votes to suspend Yoon, with the prime minister set to take over if successful.

title: DOGE leaders Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy react to 'absurd' federal remote work practices
content: A new report reveals that a mere 6% of federal employees work on-site full-time, while nearly one-third are fully remote. Critics, including Elon Musk, question government efficiency, with Musk asserting that barely 1% of federal workers, excluding security and maintenance, work a full 40-hour week in person.
summary: A new report reveals that a mere 6% of federal employees work on-site full-time, while nearly one-third are fully remote.  Critics, including Elon Musk, question government efficiency, with Musk asserting that barely 1% of federal workers, excluding security and maintenance, work a full 40-hour week in person.

title: Royal fans spot unusual in JFK's grandson Jack Schlossberg's Instagram story. What is it?
content: Royal watchers were surprised to spot a photo of Prince William and Princess Kate in Jack Schlossberg's Instagram story. Schlossberg, grandson of JFK, praised Prince William's Earthshot Prize, an initiative inspired by JFK's moonshot speech. He also recently criticized an auction of his aunt's belongings.
summary: Royal watchers were surprised to spot a photo of Prince William and Princess Kate in Jack Schlossberg's Instagram story.  Schlossberg, grandson of JFK, praised Prince William's Earthshot Prize, an initiative inspired by JFK's moonshot speech.  He also recently criticized an auction of his aunt's belongings.
